definition[0]: equally likely to happen or not happen
example[0]: We made it to the airport, but it was nip and tuck.
definition[1]: if two competitors are nip and tuck in a race or competition, they are doing equally well
example[1]: The fourth quarter was nip and tuck, but the Bulls won 92â€“90.
definition[2]: a medical operation on your face or stomach that is done to make you look younger or thinner
example[2]: I might consider getting a nip and tuck in a few years' time.
